page.title: 17A Steelworker's thoughts
page.content: I have worked at BSC,Rotherham (Aldwarke site) for 26 years as a Coil Examiner in the Continuous Bar Mill. At my mill 25% of the workforce went 13 years ago when we changed from a four- to a three-shift system. Since 1980 there have been many redundancies which would have been compulsory if 'volunteers' had not come forward. I 'escaped' because of seniority but I do not fancy the rest of my life on the dole or being shunted from one job to another. When I left school in 1959 I could have worked at New Stubbin or Aldwarke Collieries, Parkgate Chemical Works, Old Parkgate Iron and Steel, Oxley's, Manvers Coking Plant, Rotherham Power Station, or the Gas Works amongst others. All these places are now closed and the jobs gone. Employment has become an ever-decreasing circle.
